section: crfmnescpp.py fcmaes/crfmnescpp.py Go to the documentation of this file.00001 # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- 00002 """ 00003 ============================================================================= 00004 00005 Fast CMA-ES - version 1.6.11 00006 00007 (c) 2025 – Dietmar Wolz 00008 (c) 2025 – Latitude 00009 00010 License: MIT 00011 00012 File: 00013 - crfmnescpp.py 00014 00015 Description: 00016 - Eigen based implementation of Fast Moving Natural Evolution Strategy 00017 for High-Dimensional Problems (CR-FM-NES), see [2]. 00018 - Derived from [3]. 00019 00020 00021 Authors: 00022 - Dietmar Wolz 00023 - romain.despoullains@latitude.eu 00024 - corentin.generet@latitude.eu 00025 00026 References: 00027 - [1] https://github.com/dietmarwo/fast-cma-es 00028 - [2] https://arxiv.org/abs/2201.11422 00029 - [3] https://github.com/nomuramasahir0/crfmnes 00030 00031 Documentation: 00032 - 00033 00034 00035 ============================================================================= 00036 """ 00037 00038 00039 import sys 00040 import os 00041 import math 00042 import ctypes as ct 00043 import numpy as np 00044 from numpy.random import PCG64DXSM, Generator 00045 from scipy.optimize import OptimizeResult, Bounds 00046 from fcmaes.evaluator import _check_bounds, _get_bounds, callback_par, parallel, call_back_par, libcmalib 00047 00048 from typing import Optional, Callable, Union 00049 from numpy.typing import ArrayLike 00050 00051 os.environ['MKL_DEBUG_CPU_TYPE'] = '5' 00052 00053 def minimize(fun: Callable[[ArrayLike], float], 00054 bounds: Optional[Bounds] = None, 00055 x0: Optional[ArrayLike] = None, 00056 input_sigma = 0.3, 00057 popsize = 32, 00058 max_evaluations = 100000, 00059 workers = None, 00060 stop_fitness = -np.inf, 00061 rg = Generator(PCG64DXSM()), 00062 runid=0, 00063 normalize = False, 00064 use_constraint_violation = True, 00065 penalty_coef = 1E5 00066 ) -> OptimizeResult: 00067 00068 """ 00069 Minimizes a given objective function using the Covariance Matrix Adaptation Evolution 00070 Strategy with Constraint Handling (CR-FM-NES). The optimization adjusts variables within the 00071 provided bounds to achieve the minimum value of the given objective function. 00072 00073 Args: 00074 fun: The objective function to be minimized. It should be a callable that takes an 00075 array-like structure as input and returns a float value as output. 00076 bounds: Optional bounds for the variables as a `Bounds` object. If not specified, 00077 the search is unbounded. 00078 x0: Optional initial guess for the independent variables as an array-like structure. 00079 If not provided, it is created randomly within the bounds. 00080 input_sigma: Initial step size(s) for the search. It can be a float or callable 00081 providing an initial sigma value. If multi-dimensional, the mean is used. 00082 popsize: The population size for the evolution. Must be an even number. If not 00083 specified, defaults to 32. 00084 max_evaluations: The maximum number of function evaluations allowed during optimization. 00085 workers: Number of parallel workers to use for evaluation. If `None` or `workers` <= 1, 00086 no parallelism is applied. 00087 stop_fitness: The fitness value at which the optimization halts if surpassed. 00088 Default is negative infinity. 00089 rg: A random generator to control stochastic behavior. Defaults to an instance of 00090 `Generator` with a `PCG64DXSM` bit generator. 00091 runid: An identifier for this particular optimization run. 00092 normalize: A boolean indicating whether to normalize the variables to the [0, 1] range 00093 during optimization. 00094 use_constraint_violation: Whether to apply penalty-based handling for constraint 00095 violations during optimization. Defaults to True. 00096 penalty_coef: Penalty coefficient for constraint violation handling. Default is 1E5. 00097 00098 Returns: 00099 OptimizeResult: An object containing the optimization results, such as the optimized 00100 variables (`x`), the function value at the solution (`fun`), the number of function 00101 evaluations performed (`nfev`), the number of iterations (`nit`), the exit status code 00102 (`status`), and whether the optimization was successful (`success`). 00103 00104 Raises: 00105 Exception: Raises an exception if the optimization failed, and an empty `OptimizeResult` 00106 is returned with default attributes indicating failure. 00107 """ 00108 00109 lower, upper, guess = _check_bounds(bounds, x0, rg) 00110 dim = guess.size 00111 if popsize is None: 00112 popsize = 32 00113 if popsize % 2 == 1: # requires even popsize 00114 popsize += 1 00115 if callable(input_sigma): 00116 input_sigma=input_sigma() 00117 if np.ndim(input_sigma) > 0: 00118 input_sigma = np.mean(input_sigma) 00119 array_type = ct.c_double * dim 00120 parfun = None if (workers is None or workers <= 1) else parallel(fun, workers) 00121 c_callback_par = call_back_par(callback_par(fun, parfun)) 00122 res = np.empty(dim+4) 00123 res_p = res.ctypes.data_as(ct.POINTER(ct.c_double)) 00124 try: 00125 optimizeCRFMNES_C(runid, c_callback_par, dim, array_type(*guess), 00126 None if lower is None else array_type(*lower), 00127 None if upper is None else array_type(*upper), 00128 input_sigma, max_evaluations, stop_fitness, 00129 popsize, int(rg.uniform(0, 2**32 - 1)), penalty_coef, 00130 use_constraint_violation, normalize, res_p) 00131 x = res[:dim] 00132 val = res[dim] 00133 evals = int(res[dim+1]) 00134 iterations = int(res[dim+2]) 00135 stop = int(res[dim+3]) 00136 res = OptimizeResult(x=x, fun=val, nfev=evals, nit=iterations, status=stop, success=True) 00137 except Exception as ex: 00138 res = OptimizeResult(x=None, fun=sys.float_info.max, nfev=0, nit=0, status=-1, success=False) 00139 if not parfun is None: 00140 parfun.stop() 00141 return res 00142 00143 class CRFMNES_C: 00144 """ 00145 Minimization of a scalar function of one or more variables using a C++ CR-FM-NES 00146 implementation, interfaced via Python using ctypes. 00147 00148 This class implements the Covariance Matrix Adaptation Evolution Strategy 00149 (CR-FM-NES) algorithm for numerical optimization problems. It relies on the 00150 underlying C++ implementation for the actual optimization and provides a Python 00151 wrapper for convenient usage. The algorithm aims to find the minimum of a scalar 00152 objective function and supports various configurations like bounds on variables, 00153 initialization parameters, and constraint handling. 00154 00155 Attributes: 00156 ptr (ctypes.POINTER): Pointer to the underlying C++ object handling the optimization. 00157 popsize (int): Population size used by the CMA-ES algorithm. 00158 dim (int): Dimension of the decision variable vector being optimized. 00159 """ 00160 def __init__(self, 00161 dim: int, 00162 bounds: Optional[Bounds] = None, 00163 x0: Optional[ArrayLike] = None, 00164 input_sigma: Optional[Union[float, ArrayLike, Callable]] = 0.3, 00165 popsize: Optional[int] = 32, 00166 rg: Optional[Generator] = Generator(PCG64DXSM()), 00167 runid: Optional[int] = 0, 00168 normalize: Optional[bool] = False, 00169 use_constraint_violation: Optional[bool] = True, 00170 penalty_coef: Optional[float] = 1E5 00171 ): 00172 00173 """ 00174 Initializes an evolutionary optimization algorithm with constrained bounds and penalty-based constraint 00175 handling. Uses randomized initial guess for optimization and allows configuration of the population size 00176 and mutation parameters. 00177 00178 Args: 00179 dim (int): The dimensionality of the optimization problem. 00180 bounds (Optional[Bounds]): The search space boundaries. If not specified, no limits are imposed. 00181 x0 (Optional[ArrayLike]): Initial guess for the optimization problem. If None, a random guess is used. 00182 input_sigma (Optional[Union[float, ArrayLike, Callable]]): Initial distribution width for mutation. 00183 Default is 0.3. Callable functions are invoked and their result used. 00184 popsize (Optional[int]): Size of the population. Default is 32. If an odd value is provided, it is 00185 incremented to ensure compatibility. 00186 rg (Optional[Generator]): Random generator for sampling. Default is Generator(PCG64DXSM()). 00187 runid (Optional[int]): Unique identifier for the optimization run. Default is 0. 00188 normalize (Optional[bool]): Indicates whether the search space should be normalized. Default is False. 00189 use_constraint_violation (Optional[bool]): Enables constraint violation handling during optimization. 00190 Default is True. 00191 penalty_coef (Optional[float]): Coefficient of the penalty term for constraints. Default is 1E5. 00192 00193 """ 00194 00195 lower, upper, guess = _get_bounds(dim, bounds, x0, rg) 00196 if popsize is None: 00197 popsize = 32 00198 if popsize % 2 == 1: # requires even popsize 00199 popsize += 1 00200 if lower is None: 00201 lower = [0]*dim 00202 upper = [0]*dim 00203 if callable(input_sigma): 00204 input_sigma=input_sigma() 00205 if np.ndim(input_sigma) > 0: 00206 input_sigma = np.mean(input_sigma) 00207 array_type = ct.c_double * dim 00208 try: 00209 self.ptr = initCRFMNES_C(runid, dim, array_type(*guess), 00210 array_type(*lower), array_type(*upper), 00211 input_sigma, popsize, int(rg.uniform(0, 2**32 - 1)), penalty_coef, 00212 use_constraint_violation, normalize) 00213 self.popsize = popsize 00214 self.dim = dim 00215 except Exception as ex: 00216 print (ex) 00217 pass 00218 00219 def __del__(self): 00220 """ 00221 Destroys the current instance and releases associated resources. 00222 00223 This destructor is called when the object is deleted, or goes out of scope 00224 to ensure proper cleanup of resources tied to the object. 00225 00226 Raises: 00227 Any destruction-related error that may arise during the resource 00228 release process. 00229 """ 00230 destroyCRFMNES_C(self.ptr) 00231 00232 def ask(self) -> np.ndarray: 00233 """ 00234 Generates a population of candidate solutions using the CR-FM-NES algorithm. 00235 00236 This method computes a new set of candidate solutions for the optimization 00237 problem using internal state and algorithm properties. It uses the specified 00238 population size and dimensionality of the problem. 00239 00240 Returns: 00241 np.ndarray: A 2D array where each row corresponds to a candidate solution. 00242 00243 Raises: 00244 Exception: If there is an error while generating the candidate solutions. 00245 """ 00246 try: 00247 lamb = self.popsize 00248 n = self.dim 00249 res = np.empty(lamb*n) 00250 res_p = res.ctypes.data_as(ct.POINTER(ct.c_double)) 00251 askCRFMNES_C(self.ptr, res_p) 00252 xs = np.empty((lamb, n)) 00253 for p in range(lamb): 00254 xs[p,:] = res[p*n : (p+1)*n] 00255 return xs 00256 except Exception as ex: 00257 print (ex) 00258 return None 00259 00260 def tell(self, ys: np.ndarray): 00261 """ 00262 Provides functionality to send an array of numerical values to a specific C-based function, with error 00263 handling in place to detect and notify when issues occur during execution. This method is particularly 00264 useful for communicating with lower-level systems or libraries that require data in specific formats. 00265 00266 Args: 00267 ys (np.ndarray): An array of numerical values to be sent to the underlying C function. 00268 00269 Returns: 00270 int: Returns the result from the C function upon successful execution, or -1 if an exception occurs. 00271 00272 Raises: 00273 Exception: Captures and prints the exception message when an error is encountered during operation. 00274 """ 00275 try: 00276 array_type_ys = ct.c_double * len(ys) 00277 return tellCRFMNES_C(self.ptr, array_type_ys(*ys)) 00278 except Exception as ex: 00279 print (ex) 00280 return -1 00281 00282 def population(self) -> np.ndarray: 00283 """ 00284 Generates and retrieves the current population of candidate solutions. 00285 00286 This method computes the population of candidate solutions for the 00287 problem space using the `populationCRFMNES_C` function. The population 00288 data is organized as a two-dimensional NumPy array where each row 00289 represents a candidate solution. 00290 00291 Returns: 00292 np.ndarray: A two-dimensional array where each row corresponds to 00293 a candidate solution in the population. Returns `None` in case 00294 of an exception. 00295 00296 Raises: 00297 Exception: If an error occurs during computation or while calling 00298 `populationCRFMNES_C`. 00299 """ 00300 try: 00301 lamb = self.popsize 00302 n = self.dim 00303 res = np.empty(lamb*n) 00304 res_p = res.ctypes.data_as(ct.POINTER(ct.c_double)) 00305 populationCRFMNES_C(self.ptr, res_p) 00306 xs = np.array(lamb, n) 00307 for p in range(lamb): 00308 xs[p] = res[p*n : (p+1)*n] 00309 return xs 00310 except Exception as ex: 00311 print (ex) 00312 return None 00313 00314 def result(self) -> OptimizeResult: 00315 """ 00316 Computes the optimization result and returns it as an `OptimizeResult` object. 00317 00318 The function retrieves the optimization output, including the optimized variables, function value, 00319 number of evaluations, number of iterations, and the status of the optimization. If an error 00320 occurs during the computation, an `OptimizeResult` object indicating failure is returned. 00321 00322 Returns: 00323 OptimizeResult: An object containing details of the optimization result, including the 00324 optimized variables (`x`), the function value at the optimized point (`fun`), the number 00325 of function evaluations (`nfev`), the number of iterations performed (`nit`), the optimization 00326 status (`status`), and whether the optimization was successful (`success`). 00327 00328 Raises: 00329 Exception: If an error occurs during the computation process, leading to the creation of a 00330 failure `OptimizeResult`. 00331 """ 00332 res = np.empty(self.dim+4) 00333 res_p = res.ctypes.data_as(ct.POINTER(ct.c_double)) 00334 try: 00335 resultCRFMNES_C(self.ptr, res_p) 00336 x = res[:self.dim] 00337 val = res[self.dim] 00338 evals = int(res[self.dim+1]) 00339 iterations = int(res[self.dim+2]) 00340 stop = int(res[self.dim+3]) 00341 res = OptimizeResult(x=x, fun=val, nfev=evals, nit=iterations, status=stop, success=True) 00342 except Exception as ex: 00343 res = OptimizeResult(x=None, fun=sys.float_info.max, nfev=0, nit=0, status=-1, success=False) 00344 return res 00345 00346 if not libcmalib is None: 00347 00348 optimizeCRFMNES_C = libcmalib.optimizeCRFMNES_C 00349 optimizeCRFMNES_C.argtypes = [ct.c_long, call_back_par, ct.c_int, \ 00350 ct.POINTER(ct.c_double), ct.POINTER(ct.c_double), ct.POINTER(ct.c_double), \ 00351 ct.c_double, ct.c_int, ct.c_double, ct.c_int, 00352 ct.c_long, ct.c_double, 00353 ct.c_bool, ct.c_bool, ct.POINTER(ct.c_double)] 00354 00355 initCRFMNES_C = libcmalib.initCRFMNES_C 00356 initCRFMNES_C.argtypes = [ct.c_long, ct.c_int, \ 00357 ct.POINTER(ct.c_double), ct.POINTER(ct.c_double), ct.POINTER(ct.c_double), \ 00358 ct.c_double, ct.c_int, 00359 ct.c_long, ct.c_double, 00360 ct.c_bool, ct.c_bool] 00361 00362 initCRFMNES_C.restype = ct.c_void_p 00363 00364 destroyCRFMNES_C = libcmalib.destroyCRFMNES_C 00365 destroyCRFMNES_C.argtypes = [ct.c_void_p] 00366 00367 askCRFMNES_C = libcmalib.askCRFMNES_C 00368 askCRFMNES_C.argtypes = [ct.c_void_p, ct.POINTER(ct.c_double)] 00369 00370 tellCRFMNES_C = libcmalib.tellCRFMNES_C 00371 tellCRFMNES_C.argtypes = [ct.c_void_p, ct.POINTER(ct.c_double)] 00372 tellCRFMNES_C.restype = ct.c_int 00373 00374 populationCRFMNES_C = libcmalib.populationCRFMNES_C 00375 populationCRFMNES_C.argtypes = [ct.c_void_p, ct.POINTER(ct.c_double)] 00376 00377 resultCRFMNES_C = libcmalib.resultCRFMNES_C 00378 resultCRFMNES_C.argtypes = [ct.c_void_p, ct.POINTER(ct.c_double)]
